div.ab: Lo! the Evil One reproached Death, and was in turn reproached: from each and to each and against each, were their taunts.
Response: To Thee be glory, Son of the Lord of All, Who diedst for all: for He was raised to give life to all, in the day of His Coming!
Satan: Jonah who conquered thee, and returned back from Sheol, became my advocate in asking, why sinners were spared?
Death: Slander not, O Evil One, the son of Amittai: he showed a face of anger, that they might praise thee more.
Satan: Quite powerless is all thy persuasion, O tyrant Death: for there pleases me nothing, of all thou hast said.
Death: For when was the word of truth pleasing to thee? A gulf is between thee and truthfulness, O lying one.
I am righteous all my days, with nought to repent: I am he that rescues from thee the sons of men.
Satan: Proclaim thy repentance, Death, thou art well come: lo! Saul also among the prophets, great cause of scorn.
If thou, Death, be justified, then for myself: I cut not off hope, likewise, of repentance.
Death: No idol with my Lord have I made, O hater of thy Lord! lo! thou by dead idols, slayest the living.
Satan: That thou, Death, art half of me, I know, and I half of thee: if half of me repents, it repents, but I marvel.
Death: Thy partner am I in share, but not in sin: mine are the slain and thine the slayers, whom thou madest sin.
Satan: My craftiness weeps for itself, when I dispute with thee: my wiles mourn over me, when I meet thee.
Death: Workers of witchcraft and soothsayers, with all their offences: the fire that thou kindledst in the world, in Sheol I have quenched.
Satan: Thou penitent who strainest out gnats, and swallowest the just: the chaste shall rend thee, who cry, from within thy belly.
Death: It is the treasure-house where I keep all the righteous: their resurrection threatens ill to thee, who didst persecute them.
Satan: The greedy one who carries all creatures, in his bowels: lo! he casts up to me that I am robbed, of my possessions.
Death: Before the stroke lament not, for it has not yet reached thee: the day will come when thou shalt cry out, and I shall hear and rejoice.
The fire will come that shall strip off thee thy very skin: as by the potsherd thou didst strip the skin of Job.
Death: The savour of sloth begins, as if to hover on me; it is then a dream that I ceased, for a short space.
It was not that words failed me, and therefore I was silent: it is for the time I grieve, that has passed idly.
The hurt done by thy speech is very great: would I had not heard it! For my whole mind is intent upon my work.
This humankind that is lost, was undone by wandering thought: slothfulness, with negligence, brought it under yoke.
The madness of desire bid for wealth, and bought it: contention with boastfulness, were the sureties.
With persistence for strength, I wage my war: and if I neglect but a little, my sway is naught.
By continual dropping, I clean the rocks: for continual dropping can dissolve even a mountain.
Habit even over nature, becomes master: it trains and leads even lions, as beasts of burden.
Habit, repose, and increase, with persistence; by these is freedom conquered, though stubborn above all.
If its will be firmly set, it breaks the fetters; but if lax, a fragile net, can capture it.
If so be that Freedom shouts, we are scattered: but if she be silent we gather together, to mock at her.
Let us cease from much speaking, lest it lead to much sloth: with one mind let us assail the wall, and lo! it is broken down.
Satan: Go thou and see to diseases, and I to snares: for to me sins and to thee pestilences, are great solace.
And even though I have paused, I have not paused from my cares: for my will at no time rests, but is ready.
